admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
trustfund:
TF020250-FRENCH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF039073-ALGERIA - LOW INCOME HOUSING
            AND TUNISIA 2ND MUNICIPAL

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory
            and project sustainability is rated as likely. The overall
            performances of both the World Bank and the Borrower are
            adjudged as satisfactory although Bank performance during
            project preparation was marginally satisfactory and the
            Government's performance lacked in due diligence to
            ensure the timely implementation of the
            project--particularly when the project suffered from lack of
            counterpart financing, implementation agencies made their
            best efforts in achieving the project's development
            objectives and quantitative targets. Lessons learned
            included the following: Well-designed institutional analysis
            should be carried out to assess human and institutional
            capacity, confirm the interest of the beneficiaries, and
            identify the optimal arrangement. The original
            implementation period was unrealistic, causing the project
            to require three extensions. In the project design which is
            focused on establishing a certain system of service
            provision, particularly projects on cadastre systems, a
            "building-block" or incremental approach may be
            applied. It is important to judge feasibility and relevancy
            when working with multiple agencies concurrently and to
            reflect them in the project design. Opportunities for policy
            dialogue could have been encouraged more during project
            implementation, particularly to increase awareness of
            policymakers of the importance of cadastre/title
            registration linked to economic and housing policy reform.
